title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India! Tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, and if you tried out something new, you can also share pictures!

**The Food Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings.**

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments:
Does anyone have a good no-machine gelato recipe?    
I've been able to make icecream successfully but  gelato has been a nightmare.
Does anyone even like Paneer Bhurji ? Maybe I dont know how to make one. Any guidance.

The recipe I use goes like this

**Ingredients**  
1 Small Onion finely chopped  
3 Cloves of Garlic finely chopped  
Red Chilli Powder  
Turmeric Powder  
1 bunch Coriander Leaves  
2 tsp Cumin Seeds  
1 tsp Hing / Asafoetida  
1 small tomato - finely chopped  
3 finely chopped green chillies  
1 tbsp Oil  
Approx 500 gms Paneer - Don't remember the quantity as I just put it according to taste

**Method**

1. Heat oil in pan
2. Saute Onions till translucent
3. Add garlic and continue to fry till golden
4. Add in hing and cumin seeds on the side and wait cumin seeds crackle
5. Add finely chopped green chillis
6. Add in finely chopped tomatoes and saute till oil separates
7. Lower heat and add in red chilli powder and turmeric
8. Once heated through crumble paneer into pan
9. Cook for 5-7 minutes
10. Add salt according to taste
11. Finally add coriander leaves

Done :)
https://youtu.be/MUzjIceBV70 is also an easy recipe
Can you share your icecream recipe?

Sure.    
Made with 2 bowls:    
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p-SikBqk2PM    
    
Made with a pan, spoon and freezer:    
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O7sQBfpQCvU    
    
I'd really suggest aiming for flavours that are uncommon (like coffee or chocolate mint) since making batches at home aren't entirely cost effective.
I thought it'd be cheaper than store-bought icecream, aw man :(
